decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly disrupt your opponent's mana base and lock them out of playing spells using cards like Magus of the Moon, Blood Moon, and Chalice of the Void while also putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Siege-Gang Commander. The deck aims to take advantage of fast mana acceleration from cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox to establish a dominant board presence early on and overwhelm the opponent before they can recover.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Monastery Swiftspear, backed up by efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning. By aggressively attacking the opponent's life total while disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will, the deck aims to close out games before the opponent can stabilize. Price of Progress adds extra reach to finish off opponents quickly, while cards like Ponder and Brainstorm provide consistency and card selection. The key strategy is to apply constant pressure and maintain control of the game tempo.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Sanctum Prelate, the deck can slow down the opponent's spells and prevent them from executing their strategy effectively. Meanwhile, cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Aether Vial allow for efficient creature deployment and equipment cheating, giving the deck a strong tempo advantage. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Flickerwisp and Phyrexian Revoker further adds to the deck's versatility and ability to disrupt the opponent's plans.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while gaining incremental advantage through card advantage and efficient removal spells. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to control the board and out-value the opponent. With a mix of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's progression and ultimately take control of the game. By efficiently managing resources and leveraging its card advantage, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through attrition.

The key concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while efficiently generating card advantage. By using cards like Cabal Therapy, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Gitaxian Probe to disrupt the opponent's hand, while also using powerful threats like Gurmag Angler and Young Pyromancer to pressure the opponent, this deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By leveraging powerful spells like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Force of Will, along with efficient cantrips like Ponder and Preordain, this deck aims to outgrind and outmaneuver the opponent in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the resources needed to generate a high storm count and cast powerful spells like Ad Nauseam or Empty the Warrens for a game-winning combo. The deck relies on efficient mana acceleration, card selection, and disruption to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a single explosive turn. Cards like Burning Wish are used to tutor for specific combo pieces, while cards like Cabal Therapy and Duress help disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect against disruption. The deck aims to win the game through efficient and powerful storm-based combo plays.

The deck focuses on efficiently casting multiple spells in a single turn to generate a high storm count, allowing the player to win the game using cards like Tendrils of Agony or Empty the Warrens. The deck runs cards like Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish to search for key combo pieces, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Cabal Therapy and Duress. The inclusion of fast mana sources like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal help to accelerate the combo, making it a powerful and versatile deck in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements such as counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Young Pyromancer. The deck aims to efficiently control the board and outvalue the opponent while deploying threats like Gurmag Angler and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy to close out the game. Additionally, the deck includes a versatile suite of spells to deal with a variety of threats, making it adaptable to different matchups and strategies.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures like Eldrazi Mimic, Reality Smasher, and Thought-Knot Seer to quickly overpower opponents. It also includes disruption cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer to control the board. The mana base is designed to support the Eldrazi creatures with lands like Ancient Tomb and Cavern of Souls. The deck aims to put pressure on opponents early in the game while also having answers to common threats through cards like Umezawa's Jitte and Spatial Contortion. Overall, it is a powerful and consistent Aggro deck with a focus on Eldrazi creatures.

This deck is focused on quickly generating mana and card advantage by utilizing the elves' abilities to tap for mana and untap each other. The goal is to ramp up mana production and draw cards with Glimpse of Nature to eventually tutor for and cast Craterhoof Behemoth to win the game in a single turn. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Deathrite Shaman and Reclamation Sage to deal with opposing threats. With Gaea's Cradle as a key resource, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its explosive combo potential.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies, generating card advantage, and controlling the board with a combination of removal, counterspells, and efficient threats. It utilizes cards like Deathrite Shaman, Cabal Therapy, and Young Pyromancer to create pressure while disrupting opponent's hands. The deck also includes a mix of planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dack Fayden for additional card advantage and control. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through a combination of disruption and threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing counter spells, card draw, and removal to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to protect its powerful win conditions such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Entreat the Angels, while also utilizing Search for Azcanta for card advantage. The inclusion of Counterbalance adds another layer of disruption for the opponent. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, allowing the deck to cast spells of various colors efficiently. Overall, the deck prioritizes control and efficiency in order to outvalue and outlast the opponent.

The deck focuses on using low-cost aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer to apply early pressure on the opponent, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Force of Will. It also includes efficient removal and disruption spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze to keep control of the board. The mana base is streamlined with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a combination of creature aggression and disruption.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token. The deck includes various tools to help search for and protect the combo pieces, such as Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Pithing Needle. It also includes disruption in the form of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to win quickly by assembling the combo while also disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature plays, using low-cost efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf to apply pressure early in the game. It also includes a suite of powerful blue spells like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Force of Will to help maintain card advantage and control the game. With disruptive spells like Daze, Spell Pierce, and Stifle, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while utilizing a mana denial strategy with Wasteland. Overall, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats.

The deck focuses on maximizing the power of Eldrazi creatures by using cards like Eldrazi Mimic and Thought-Knot Seer to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With a combination of aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Endless One, supported by disruptive spells like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of utility lands like Karakas and Mishra's Factory helps to provide additional options and flexibility in different matchups. Overall, the deck is designed to be fast and disruptive, aiming to close out games quickly.
